parallel

Class UnboundedMsgPassingCoordinator

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.UnboundedMsgPassingCoordinator

  • public class UnboundedMsgPassingCoordinator
extends java.lang.Object
    Exactly the same as MsgPassingCoordinator except that its queue is unbounded, and therefore cannot throw ParallelException in cases where having a full queue would throw. The class is useful when having a (short enough) bounded queue may result in the process hanging (due to starvation), and therefore, very large buffers would otherwise need to be allocated up front (see for example the popt4jlib.GA.DGA class, where in order to have determinism in the order in which incumbents are set in the main class, the msg-passing mechanism is used).

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2017

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      • sendData

        public void sendData(int myid,
                     java.lang.Object data)
        stores the data object to be consumed by any thread that invokes recvData() method -regardless of which thread that is- as long as the thread is not interested in who the sender is, or as long as it's interested in msgs from thread with id myid. The method returns immediately.
        Parameters:
        myid - int the id of the thread calling this method
        data - Object

      • sendData

        public void sendData(int myid,
                     int threadId,
                     java.lang.Object data)
              throws ParallelException
        stores the data object to be consumed only by the first thread that invokes the method recvData(threadId)- as long as the thread is not interested in who the sender is, or as long as it's interested in msgs from thread with id myid. The method returns immediately.
        Parameters:
        myid - int my thread's id
        threadId - int the id of the thread that is the recipient
        data - Object
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if myid==threadId

      • recvData

        public java.lang.Object recvData(int myid)
        retrieves the first data Object that has been stored via a call (from another thread) to sendData(data) or sendData(threadId, data). If no such data exists, the calling thread will wait until another thread stores an appropriate datum. This implementation will invoke wait() if a selective receive operation is currently under way by another thread, and will be notified when the selective receive finishes.
        Parameters:
        myid - int
        Returns:
        Object

      • recvDataIfAnyExist

        public java.lang.Object recvDataIfAnyExist(int myid)
        the method has the same semantics as the recvData(tid) method except that it returns immediately with null if no appropriate data exist at the time of the call. There is one exception: this implementation will invoke wait() first if a selective receive operation is currently under way by another thread (without checking if any data exist or not), and will be notified when the selective receive finishes.
        Parameters:
        myid - int the threadId
        Returns:
        Object

      • recvData

        public java.lang.Object recvData(int myid,
                                 int fromid)
                          throws ParallelException
        retrieves the first data Object that has been stored via a call to sendData(fromid, data) or sendData(fromid, threadId, data). In other words, we wait for a msg from a particular thread. If no such data exists, the calling thread will wait until the right thread stores an appropriate datum. This implementation will invoke wait() first if a selective receive operation is currently under way by another thread, and will be notified when the selective receive finishes.
        Parameters:
        myid - int
        fromid - int the sender's id
        Returns:
        Object
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if myid==fromid

      • recvDataIfAnyExist

        public java.lang.Object recvDataIfAnyExist(int myid,
                                           int fromid)
                                    throws ParallelException
        the method has the same semantics as the recvData(tid) method except that it returns immediately with null if no appropriate data exist at the time of the call. There is one exception: this implementation will invoke wait() first if a selective receive operation is currently under way by another thread (without checking if any data exist or not), and will be notified when the selective receive finishes.
        Parameters:
        myid - int
        fromid - int the msg must be from this sender
        Returns:
        Object
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if myid==fromid

      • selRecvData

        public PairObjDouble selRecvData(int myid,
                                 java.util.List fromids)
                          throws ParallelException,
                                 java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        perform essentially a selective-receive (interruptible) blocking operation.
        Parameters:
        myid - int
        fromids - List // List<Integer>
        Returns:
        PairObjDouble a Pair object whose "object" part is the received data and the "Double" part is the integer id of the fromids list on which the data was received.
        Throws:
        ParallelException - if the first arg is contained in the second arg.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the operation is interrupted by some other thread calling interrupt() on the thread executing the selRecvData() while it's on wait-mode.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if fromids is null or empty
